https://beta.openai.com/docs/guides/embeddings

title: stdenv/linux/default.nix: add gcc rebuild during bootstrap by trofi · Pull Request #209063 · NixOS/nixpkgs

last_post.content:
Spent past few days exploring nixpkgs bootstrap process.

Did you know that your glibc package contains libgcc_s.so.1 from gcc-8 even if the rest of the system is built with gcc-11? Most of the time it does not matter. But sometimes it breaks in unusual ways.

Here is my attempt to fix it: https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/209063

And a few words and pictures to explain how nixpkgs bootstrap is laid out and how I tried to fix it: https://trofi.github.io/posts/275-nixpkgs-bootstrap-deep-dive.html

#bug #nixpkgs #bootstrap

If anyone reading this has write access to the #Mastodon #GitHub repo, I'd appreciate a review to unblock this change:

https://github.com/mastodon/mastodon/pull/22393

To improve #privacy, it reduces the default retention period of IP addresses from one year to two days.

Given that most admins are unlikely to change the default, this means that more visitors to Mastodon servers would be less vulnerable to their activity being tracked by government authorities.

Yes! @IsaPirsic found that my dream shape is called a 'gyroelongated square bipyramid':

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gyroelongated_square_bipyramid

It's also called a 'tetrakis square antiprism', or a 'heccaidecadeltahedron'.

The awkward names fit its awkward shape. It looks like an icosahedron that went on a diet and lost too much weight.

It's one of the 92 'Johnson solids': strictly convex polyhedra with regular polygons as faces that do *not* have enough symmetry to map any vertex to any other.

Hurrah!

title: Capped square antiprismatic molecular geometry - Wikipedia

last_post.content:
Here's the "capped square antiprismatic molecular geometry", from Wikipedia:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capped_square_antiprismatic_molecular_geometry

It's *roughly* a square antiprism with a square pyramid on top. But it's missing the square pyramid on bottom.

And the square on the bottom of the antiprism is smaller than the square on top. That's because the atoms want to be roughly the same distance from their neighbors.

You'll also see an atom in the middle! An atom of rhenium will surround itself with 9 hydrogens this way.

(4/n)

title: 20 years of Safari: A visual history

last_post.content:
Safari just turned 20 years old.

I was so excited when I heard Apple made a browser. I immediately started using it as my primary browser. And have for 2 decades.

When I learned about Firebug, I started doing all my web development in Firefox (the only developer tools at the time). But I kept using Safari as my main browser.

I’ve always loved how gorgeous it is.

I can’t believe how lucky I am to get to work on it today.

https://www.cultofmac.com/801831/20-years-of-safari-visual-history/

One of the most impressive studies of #OpenScience in #qualitative research that I have ever read (:ClosedAccess:, but worth accessing if you can).

The authors describe a deeply thoughtful approach to enlisting research participants from a vulnerable population in a process of archiving interview data.

As one participant stated: “If we’re strong enough to give you the story, then we should be allowed to have it the way we want it.”

https://doi.org/10.1037/tra0001358

"It may well be true that "plot and eye" is the most diverse channel to the human mind. Not that it transmits more bits per second, but rather that it will transmit a greater variety of messages on unexpected topics easily and rapidly. There really seems to be no substitute for "looking at the data.”"

Tukey JW. Analyzing data: Sanctification or detective work? American Psychologist. US: American Psychological Association; 1969;24:83–91. DOI: https://doi.org/10.1037/h0027108

#DataViz #Statistics #Stats

If you’re at the right place at the right time, with the right equipment, this is possible.

Last night, with guidance from https://transit-finder.com/, I positioned myself along the narrow line where the International #SpaceStation would pass between me and the nearly full moon.

I used a Fujifilm X-T4 shooting 4K video through a Celestron 8” SCT to capture the pass. Then, back at the computer this morning, put together these views with PIPP, Registax, and GIMP.

Quite pleased. My best yet.
